Sure, here's an alternative 5-day itinerary for a Switzerland holiday with less travel:

Day 1: Basel

* Explore the old town of Basel, including the Basel Minster and the Rhine River.
* Visit the Fondation Beyeler, a museum with a collection of modern and contemporary art.

Day 2: Lucerne

* Take the train from Basel to Lucerne (around 1 hour journey).
* Visit the Lion Monument, Chapel Bridge and the picturesque old town of Lucerne.
* Take a boat ride on Lake Lucerne, enjoying the views of the surrounding mountains.

Day 3: Mount Rigi

* Take the train from Lucerne to Vitznau (around 30 minutes journey).
* Take the cogwheel train to the top of Mount Rigi, where you can enjoy stunning views of Lake Lucerne and the surrounding mountains.
* Return to Lucerne in the evening for a relaxed dinner.

Day 4: Zurich

* Take the train from Lucerne to Zurich (around 45 minutes journey).
* Visit the Kunsthaus Zurich, a museum with an impressive collection of Swiss art.
* Walk along the Bahnhofstrasse, one of the most famous shopping streets in the world.
* Visit the Fraumünster Church and see the famous Chagall windows.

Day 5: St. Gallen

* Take the train from Zurich to St. Gallen (around 1.5 hour journey).
* Visit the UNESCO-listed Abbey of St. Gallen, with its impressive library and Baroque architecture.
* Explore the old town of St. Gallen, known for its ornate facades and charming atmosphere.

This itinerary allows you to explore some of Switzerland's most beautiful cities and natural landscapes without too much travel time. You can always adjust the itinerary to fit your preferences and interests.
